subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Call of Cthulhu, through part 2
msgSnippet: * Sime *is a surname which traces back to the Clan Fraser, and the name /Shimidh/,
messageBody:
"Sime is a surname which traces back to the Clan Fraser, and the name Shimidh, Gaelic for Simon."
So saying it as /saim/ is arguably correct, as Sime corresponds to Simon.

I love Wikipedia.

On 7/28/2013 5:26 AM, Nathan Sharfi wrote:
Most of my free time's been spent on font work, but I've managed to post typo fixes to Github, at the usual <https://github.com/adiabatic/qs-literature>. This takes me up to the end of part 2.

How _does_ one pronounce the surname of Sidney H. Sime, though? [simE] sounds unlikely for a Briton. I'd figure [saIm], but I don't exactly trust myself in these matters…
